Remarks. This cosmopolitan species can be distinguished from other species by having dimples on dorsal shields of uniform size, dorsal body setae long, falciform with marginal spinules, and dorsal setae c 1 widely spaced. The characters of our specimens identified as
E. segnis
are similar to other known specimens.

Eustigmaeus turcicus Do
ğ an & Ayyıldız

Distribution. Turkey (
Doġan & Ayyıldız 2003 b
;
Doġan 2005
, 2007;
Erman et al . 2007
; Akyol 2007 ).

Remarks. This species, known only from Turkey , can be distinguished from others by the shape of the dorsal dimples and dorsal setae, and the numbers of femoral and paragenital setae. General features of our specimens identified as
E. turcicus
are as in the type specimens. However, they have ornamentations on striated integument between the prodorsal and hysterosomal shield (
Figure 14
).
